page.title: 18OAK TREE IN UPEND VILLAGE
page.content: The oak tree in Upend village is on a little green with wild flowers around it. There is a metal fence round the tree and a plaque which says: "THIS TREE WAS PLANTED TO COMMEMORATE THE CORONATION OF OUR BELOVED QUEEN ELIZABETH 11 BY HER LOYAL SUBJECTS IN THE VILLAGE OF UPEND ON THE SECOND OF JUNE 1953." The oak tree is 11\ metres high. To measure the height we got a half metre and a whole metre stick. We laid the metre stick down, and stood the half metre stick up at the end of it. We lined it up to the tree top. The distance to the tree was 23m so the height was half that. Around its girth is 1metre. The branches spread out to the north by 3.60m, to the east by 6m, to the south by 5.20m, and to the west by 4.20m.
